title: It is real
review:
Amy (Ashleigh Dorrell ) is an Irish-American going to school in Limerick. She gets a nightshift job at the Limerick Hotel where 10 years ago some gruesome murders happened. They never found the killer.

Amy is afraid of the dark, a feature that was not utilized that well. The feature demonstrated Stephen King influences, and there were times I thought I was watching the master himself. The soundtrack needed to be more engaging and the revelation of the killer's identification didn't go that well, primarily due to a lack of suspects, Scooby-Doo.

Nice ghost-slasher.

Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity even though Amy takes two showers.

title: Better watch season 5 of American Horror Story
review: Poor directing, poor acting, dumb story, not original, the only ones who clearly LOVE it is the film crew (7 x 10 stars???). Want so see a Hotel horror movie worth your while? See The Shining, Vacancy, Hostel, Cold Prey or my favorite from 1981(!) The Beyond.

title: Very good execution of a good thought out plot!
review: Absolutely surprising given the ratings some amateurs have left, don't trust its overall score, its a slow burner granted, but its a good plot, a good setting and the acting is good too! You can tell everyone involved was dedicated to this film. Definitely worth the watch.
